results.title: A powerful earthquake violently shakes Haiti, killing dozens.

results.title: A Sicilian Town Sends an Omen of a Much Hotter Future
results.abstract: Floridia may have hit 124 degrees Fahrenheit this week, possibly the highest temperature ever recorded in Europe, offering Italy and the entire Mediterranean a preview of things to come.

multimedia.caption: The deserted Madonna del Carmine square on Friday in Floridia, Sicily. “Floridia is now the center of the world when it comes to the climate,” said its mayor, Marco Carianni.

results.title: Latest U.K. Scandals Show a System Rife With Insider Ties
results.abstract: For years, Britain relied on an informal code of gentlemen’s agreements to help prevent influence-peddling and cronyism in politics. Some say that no longer works.

Mohammad Ismail Khan, center, last week in Herat. He rose to prominence in the mujahedeen resistance to the Soviets, and then fought against the Taliban in the 1990s.

results.title: For a Crime at 14, He Faces Death in a Case Casting Doubt on Saudi Reforms
results.abstract: The kingdom has announced changes to its justice system, but still sentenced a teenager to death for a robbery and the killing of a police officer, despite an alibi and claims of a forced confession.
results.byline: By Asmaa al-Omar and Ben Hubbard

results.title: Floods devastate northern Turkey, killing at least 27 and leaving dozens missing.
results.abstract: In one small town, eight members of an extended family were missing after a building collapse, including four children.

multimedia.caption: A collapsed building in the town of Bozkurt, Turkey, on Friday. At least eight people, including four young children, were still missing following the collapse of another building in the town.

results.title: French leaders call for vigilance amid vandalism at vaccine sites.
results.abstract: Officials say there have been 22 cases of vandalism at health sites since July 12, amid protests over the government’s Covid-19 health pass policy.
